payload.name: paraconsistent
payload.core: Tolerate contradictions without explosion. Classical logic derives everything from A and not-A (ex falso quodlibet); paraconsistent logics contain contradictions locally, enabling reasoning to continue in unaffected domains. Key insight: contradiction is quarantined, not ignored or resolved.

out.d: explicit list of conflicting propositions with sources, timestamps, and affected domains
domains isolated from contradiction propagation; includes boundary predicates that block inference chains
conclusions derivable despite inconsistency; each tagged with dependency proof showing no path to quarantined propositions
ranked assessment: action-blocking (must resolve before decision) vs deferrable (can proceed with flag)
prioritized backlog of contradictions with deadlines, owners, and escalation thresholds

proc: detect contradictions: scan for A and not-A pairs; record source, timestamp, first-observed context
assess impact: classify as action-blocking (halts critical path) or containable (deferrable)
define quarantine boundary: specify which predicates/domains are tainted; boundary must be minimal
verify isolation: confirm no inference chain crosses from quarantined to safe domains
continue locally: derive conclusions in consistent subdomains; tag each with 'quarantine-free' proof
schedule resolution: assign deadline based on severity; action-blocking < 1 decision cycle, containable < 3 cycles
monitor drift: track if quarantine zones grow; >20% growth triggers escalation
check: every contradiction has source attribution and timestamp
quarantine boundaries are explicit and minimal (no over-isolation)
no inference chain crosses quarantine boundary (verified by dependency trace)
action-blocking contradictions have resolution deadline < next decision point
resolution backlog has bounded size (alert if >10 unresolved contradictions)
quarantine zone growth rate monitored (alert if >20% expansion per cycle)

enter_when: data sources report conflicting values for same proposition
time pressure prevents immediate conflict resolution
blocking all operations on contradiction would cause greater harm than proceeding
multiple authoritative sources disagree and no tie-breaker exists
exit_when: contradiction resolved via belief-revision or source correction
quarantine zone growth exceeds 20% per cycle (escalate to belief-revision)
action-blocking contradiction encountered (switch to belief-revision or argumentation)
resolution backlog exceeds threshold (trigger systematic reconciliation)
stay_in_if: safe inferences continue to support required decisions

quick_checklist: Can I identify both sides of the contradiction explicitly? (if vague, not ready for paraconsistent)
Is the contradiction binary (A vs not-A) or gradual (values differ)? (gradual → consider fuzzy logic)
Can I draw a boundary that isolates the conflict from my current decision? (if no → resolve first)
Do I have a deadline for resolution? (if no → set one now)
Am I tracking quarantine zone growth? (if no → start)

common_confusions.distinction: Paraconsistent: proposition is both true AND false (contradiction). Fuzzy: proposition is partially true (degree 0.7). Paraconsistent quarantines; fuzzy aggregates.
common_confusions.test: Is the conflict 'A vs not-A' (paraconsistent) or 'A to degree X' (fuzzy)?

common_confusions.distinction: Paraconsistent: tolerate contradiction, continue reasoning elsewhere. Belief-revision: immediately repair contradiction by retracting beliefs. Paraconsistent defers; belief-revision resolves.
common_confusions.test: Do I need to act now despite the conflict (paraconsistent) or can I pause to fix it (belief-revision)?

common_confusions.distinction: Paraconsistent: handles outright contradiction (A and not-A both asserted). Defeasible: handles defeat (A unless B; B defeats A). Paraconsistent quarantines; defeasible computes winners.
common_confusions.test: Are both claims actively asserted (paraconsistent) or does one override the other (defeasible)?

common_confusions.distinction: Paraconsistent: still uses true/false but blocks explosion. Many-valued: introduces third+ values (unknown, both, neither). Paraconsistent contains; many-valued reclassifies.
common_confusions.test: Do I know both values and they conflict (paraconsistent) or is the truth status itself unclear (many-valued)?

diff.deductive: tolerates contradictions (quarantines) vs explodes from them (ex falso quodlibet)
diff.belief-revision: defers contradiction resolution vs repairs immediately by retracting beliefs
diff.argumentation: isolates conflicts from other reasoning vs structures competing claims into attack/support graphs
diff.defeasible: blocks explosion from contradiction vs computes which defaults defeat others
diff.fuzzy-logic: handles binary conflict (A and not-A) vs handles degree of truth (A to degree 0.7)
diff.many-valued: retains true/false but contains contradiction vs introduces third+ truth values
diff.rough-set: quarantines inconsistent propositions vs models boundary regions of uncertain classification

signals: contradictions never resolved; backlog age > 5 decision cycles
team treats inconsistency as normal operating state
resolution backlog grows unbounded (>10 items with no resolution progress)

mitigations.test: every new contradiction classified as action-blocking or deferrable within 1 hour
mitigations.escalation: unclassified contradiction after 1 hour → treat as action-blocking

mitigations.test: action-blocking: resolved before next decision; deferrable: resolved within 3 cycles
mitigations.escalation: missed deadline → escalate to belief-revision mode with forced retraction

mitigations.test: measure zone size each cycle; alert if >20% growth
mitigations.escalation: >20% growth → pause new work, prioritize reconciliation
>10 items → block new contradictions until backlog reduced

mitigations.test: weekly review of all quarantine zones; verify boundaries still minimal
mitigations.escalation: audit finds over-isolation → tighten boundaries; finds leakage → emergency containment

use: merging inconsistent data sources under time pressure
messy enterprise data integration (ETL with conflicting schemas)
early incident response triage (conflicting reports, act on overlap)
requirements analysis with stakeholder conflicts (proceed on agreed subset)
legacy system migration (old and new systems report different values)
multi-stakeholder input reconciliation (defer resolution, act on consensus)
regulatory compliance with conflicting standards (satisfy overlap, flag gaps)

rel.r: explodes on contradiction; paraconsistent blocks explosion
structures competing claims; paraconsistent isolates them
manages defeat relations; paraconsistent handles ties
handles partial truth; paraconsistent handles full contradiction
introduces new truth values; paraconsistent retains classical values
models boundary uncertainty; paraconsistent models outright conflict
decides when to tolerate vs resolve

ex.sit: Database merger: Source A says customer X lives in NYC. Source B says customer X lives in LA. Need to process orders now, shipping deadline in 2 hours.
steps: detect: address(X, NYC) contradicts address(X, LA); sources: CRM-legacy vs CRM-new; detected at 14:00
assess: shipping depends on address (action-blocking for shipping); order validity, payment, inventory do not (safe)
quarantine: isolate address predicate; boundary = {address(X, *)}; all other customer predicates unaffected
verify: order-valid(X) has no dependency on address(X, *); payment-cleared(X) has no dependency; inventory-reserved(X) has no dependency
continue: process order validation, payment, inventory reservation → all succeed
schedule: address conflict deadline = 15:30 (30 min before shipping cutoff); assigned to data-ops
flag: shipping module blocks on address resolution; if unresolved by 15:30, escalate to manual fulfillment
ex.insight: business continues on consistent subset; contradiction contained to shipping domain; deadline forces resolution before action-blocking moment

micro_example.sit: Two config files specify different timeout values: config-prod.yaml says 30s, config-legacy.yaml says 60s. Deployment in 5 minutes.
micro_example.paraconsistent_response: Quarantine timeout predicate. Deploy with conservative value (60s). Log contradiction. Resolve post-deploy.
micro_example.wrong_approach: Block deployment until resolved (may miss window). Or ignore conflict (may cause production issue).
micro_example.key_test: Can I identify a safe default that doesn't depend on the contradiction? If yes → paraconsistent. If no → resolve first.
